qas.question: Where did Feynman work at in Brazil?
Which place in Russia could Feynman not visit, but wished to do so?
When was Feynman allowed to go to Tuva?
Who went to Tuva in Feynman's stead?
What is the name of the film that discusses Feynman's attempt to get to Tuva?
Where did Feynman work at in Japan?
Which place in Germany could Feynman not visit but wished to do so?
When was Feynman found visiting Tuva?
Who avoided Tuva in Feynman's stead?
What is the name of the film that discusses Feynman's attempt to escape from Tuva?

context: Feynman traveled to Brazil, where he gave courses at the BCPF (<a0_0><b5_0>Brazilian Center for Physics Research<b5_0/><a0_0/>) and near the end of his life schemed to visit the Russian land of <a1_0><b6_0>Tuva<b6_0/><a1_0/>, a dream that, because of Cold War bureaucratic problems, never became reality. <a2_0><b7_0>The day after he died<b7_0/><a2_0/>, a letter arrived for him from the Soviet government, giving him authorization to travel to Tuva. Later <a3_0><b8_0>Feynman's daughter Michelle<b8_0/><a3_0/> would realize this journey. Out of his enthusiastic interest in reaching Tuva came the phrase "Tuva or Bust" (also the title of a book about his efforts to get there), which was tossed about frequently amongst his circle of friends in hope that they, one day, could see it firsthand. The documentary movie, <a4_0><b9_0>Genghis Blues<b9_0/><a4_0/>, mentions some of his attempts to communicate with Tuva and chronicles the successful journey there by his friends. Responding to Hubert Humphrey's congratulation for his Nobel Prize, Feynman admitted to a long admiration for the then vice president.
